etymology.interpretation: Combines the road/walking element 辶 with the phonetic 畐, suggesting being driven or pressed along a path. The sound comes from 畐 (fú), whose sense of fullness/pressure also subtly aligns with the idea of compelling or forcing forward.

examples.chinese: 他被逼签字(他被逼簽字)。
父母不要逼孩子选择专业(父母不要逼孩子選擇專業)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ bú yào bī háizi xuǎnzé zhuānyè.
examples.english: Parents shouldn’t force children to choose a major.

examples.chinese: 现实逼得他离开家乡(現實逼得他離開家鄉)。
examples.pinyin: Xiànshí bī de tā líkāi jiāxiāng.
examples.english: Reality compelled him to leave his hometown.
